article_title: Court Weighs Penalty in Bank of America 'Hustle' Case
article_text:
A federal judge said Thursday that he would consider the "public purpose" of imposing a penalty on Bank of America Corp. for the fraudulent actions of its Countrywide unit in a mortgage program called the "Hustle."

Manhattan District Court Judge Jed Rakoff made the point while hearing arguments from the U.S. government and Bank of America over what size penalty should be imposed on the bank for the actions of Countrywide Financial Corp., which the bank purchased in 2008. In October, a jury found the...
